document_data.name: ''Deepchill''
document_data.mainbody: '''''Deepchill''''' was a [[Sentient item|sentient]] [[Dwarf|dwarven]] ''[[frostbrand]]'' [[broadsword]] that came into the possession of [[Vinjarek|Vinjarek the Mound King]] sometime before the mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Description: The [[blade]] reflected light as if it were made of ice.
document_data.Personality:
As a dwarven weapon, ''Deepchill'' was only happy when underground, and moreso if its owner was a dwarf. It was intelligent and could speak [[Dwarvish]] as well as the [[lawful neutral]] [[alignment language]], although its preference was always for using Dwarvish. It despised anyone with whom it was unable to speak.

''Deepchill'' was referred to both as "it" and as "he/him".
document_data.Powers: The sword had an exceptionally powerful [[magic]] edge and was twice as mighty when fighting wielders of [[fire]]. It also had the automatic ability to ''[[detect secret doors]]'', ''[[detect sloping passages]]'', and ''[[detect elevator/shifting rooms/walls]]'', although the blade had to be within {{SI|10|feet|long=yes}} or closer for these powers to function.
document_data.History:
In ancient times, ''Deepchill'' belonged to a dwarven king in [[the North]].

The blade was later found and claimed by the [[great wight]] Vinjarek, who declared himself the Mound King of the Tombs of Deckon Thar. While ''Deepchill'' was Vinjarek's most prized possession, the sword disliked its [[lawful evil]] owner, who was unable to understand or speak with it. However, this did not stop the Mound King from gaining complete mastery over ''Deepchill''. 

Over the centuries that followed, ''Deepchill''<nowiki>'</nowiki>s fine scabbard rotted away, leaving only the gems that had once adorned it.
